import "./ahc.css" export default function Ahc10() { return (

How to find and fix the causes of your bad habits

  • A craving is just a underlying manifestation of a deeper underlying motive
  • Your current habits are not the necessarily the best way to solve the problems you face they are just methods you learned to use
  • Our behaviour is heavily dependent on how we interpret the events that happen to us, not necessarily the objective reality of the events themselves
  • Two people can look at a cigarette and one feels the urge to smoke and other is repulsed by the smell.
  • The same cue can spark a good habit or a bad habit depending on your prediction.
  • Cause of habits is actually the prediction that precedes them
  • Desire is the difference between where you are and where you want to be right now
  • When emotions and feelings are impaired, we actually lose the ability to make decisions
  • Highlight the benefits of avoiding a bad habit to make its seem unattractive
  • The specific cravings you feel are really an attempt to address your fundamental underlying motives
  • Reprogram your brain to enjoy hard habits
  • Change “have” to “get”
  • I get to wake up early morning, I get to exercise, I get to sleep early to bed
  • The key to finding and fixing the causes of your bad habits is to reframe the associations you have about them
  • It’s not easy but if you can reprogram your predictions you can transform a hard habit to an easy one
) }
